title: The BIGGEST, The BEST, The FEAST
body_text:
The 2014 East Coast Dodgeball Thanksgiving festivities have concluded in record fashion. The most iconic female of them all, DIANA DIBUCCIO, indeed suffered the humiliating, albeit tasty whipped-cream pie courtesy her "bestie" and ECD's greatest woman warrior, MELISSA KERR. The encounter - years in the making really - was one for the ages under the bright lights of the ECD battlezone. Those brave enough to have experienced it departed full of dodgeball goodness.
________________________________________
________________________________________
_________
MATCH SUMMARY
Kerr's first choice was the incomparable Kevin Fitzpatrick; DiBuccio's #1 selection was the returning all-star, Rob Pellecchia. The rest of the stars in attendance were equally divided and showcased their talents for over two full hours.
The leading ladies split the first two rounds; from there, "Killer" Kerr took the advantage at 2-1 and later 3-1. DiBuccio and her  supporting cast managed to cut the deficit to 1 after the fifth game, but Kerr maintained the lead for the remainder of the event.
The game-by-game results are as follows: Game 1, 3, 4, 6, 7, 9 (Kerr); Game 2, 5, 8, 10 (DiBuccio)
QUICK RECORDS
Attendance: 16* | 10 men, 6 women
New Players: 2 | Kris Mottley, Michael Newkirk
Score Keeper: Alexis Carter
Opening Rushman: Dan Spengeman
*9 members of the ECDElite Hall of Fame comprised the total turnout
CAPTAINS STATISTICS
DiBuccio ...
► first player to lose
two
CREAMation matches in ECD history
► broke record for the longest stretch between CREAMation encounters, ECD 91-202 (previous C. Adams, ECD 105-189)
► only the 5th player to compete in 2 CREAMation encounters (Tronolone & Letsche 3; C. Adams & V. Winston 2)
► faced her 17th different opponent, breaking her own record set at ECD 200 in August 2013
► first of two women (w/ Kerr) to headline a Thanksgiving event
► this match was her 11th singles contest (tied w/ C. Adams for 2nd most) and her 15th overall (3rd most all-time)
Kerr ...
► won her very first captains match, with a record of 1-2-0
► prior to the match, she was the only member of the ECDElite Hall of Fame to have never won a captains bout
► first of two women (w/ DiBuccio) to headline a Thanksgiving event
► this match was only her 2nd singles contest and just her 3rd overall
